instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Hi, I have this card that had a short on ppbus that I identified thanks to the Flir si <CAPACITOR>C6505</CAPACITOR> the problem is that I do not have a replacement capacitor and wanting to recover it from a donor card there are only 22UF 6.3v or max 10v or 25v there are only polyester what do you recommend me to do?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Should work without it, but is better to solder one.
You can use 10-22uF/25V; 16V may resist, but not recommended.
